    About

    My name is Jonathan Nicholas, former information security consultant turned pilot in training as of late 2017.

    After 5 years in the IT security industry, conducting fascinating projects and fun research like:

    • Threat information sharing with Athena
    • Athena – Github
    I decided to pursue a different line of work that I believe will keep me happier into later life. I have been fortunate enough to have some incredible experiences. It has led me to realise two things I cherish: a passion for aviation which has led me to pursue an aviation career and a love of the outdoors.
    So you ask what are these experiences? Here are two of my favourites and most nostalgic:

    Flying through the Welsh valleys at 500ft at 420kts in a RAF Hawk T1a:

    Trekking through the Cordillera Real in Bolivia descending from summit attempt at Huayna Potosí (6088m):

    I am the guy who –

    • Likes to walk up mountains come rain, snow, wind or shine.
    • Will give you facts about the plane you are flying on.
    • Is more excited about the flight than the holiday at the end of it.
    • Always stops and looks if a plane is flying past.
    • Tinkers and breaks tech.

    Summary: – I’m an aviation and technology geek with a passion for the outdoors.

    Please reach out by posting comments or contacting me directly via Contact.
